<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are seeking to recruit a curious <b>Key Account Manager (m\u002Ff\u002Fd)<\u002Fb>, full time, to join the Commercial Team at the Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland, near Cologne.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland is one of the key sites in Shell's Global portfolio. The total site size has 17 million tons per annum crude oil procession capacity with up to 3.000 staff being employed on site.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What the role is?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Energy transition is a buzzword almost everyone can relate to, but what does this mean for Shell’s Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland? Join the Commercial Team in Rheinland and actively shape the future role of our site during the energy transition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Take responsibility and actively manage existing key accounts in a variety of contracts including sales, purchase, and asset contracts. Current contract counterparties are mainly chemical industry players, defined logistic partners as well as Shell entities other than Shell Deutschland GmbH.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Area of impact does include contract governance, contract management and contract operations, assuring compliance of activities and documentation throughout necessary tools and systems.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Drive the commercial strategy and contractual implementation as part of a deal and negotiation team. Excellent commercial acumen, market knowledge, competitive intelligence, as well as the ability to create collaboration opportunities with other industry players will guide you through development and implementation of a holistic commercial strategy striving towards exchange of new, more sustainable products and feedstocks with our customers and partners.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be working on various challenging, unstructured, and non-standard questions that have a high relevance to the business together with multi-cultural teams from different businesses within the Shell organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Being the commercial and operative counterpart in Shell for all 3rd party product and asset contracts for Manufacturing Germany including purchase contracts (mainly utilities) Full responsibility for several small\u002Fmedium contracts which includes preparing and leading negotiations (with mandate)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Main goal is to operate and commercially optimise existing contract portfolio and establish business relationships with a strong focus to further develop new business opportunities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Drive operational excellence in contract management with the goal to increase value or prevent value leakage for Shell.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Achieve and\u002For maintain highest customer satisfaction, supplier performance and contractual obligation management.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proactive and continuous exchange of information and engagement with the stakeholder community in Rheinland and beyond (Businesses, Refinery operations, Economics &amp; Scheduling, Trading Desks, Manufacturing, Service Centers, Tax, Legal, Credit, Finance, HSE)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> A university degree in business, engineering or similar field (Masters level)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Significant working experience with direct external party contact required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High degree of commercial acumen and enthusiasm to identify business opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Entrepreneurial spirit, strong ability to tackle unstructured challenges, eagerness to start from scratch and develop future commercial opportunities in a structured way<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong execution skills and a positive hands-on mentality<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Negotiation skills, ability to achieve good outcome also in difficult situations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to manage conflicts (internal and external), high persistency required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stress resistance and ability to manage several topics at the same time, strong commitment to deadlines<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Curiosity, flexibility, and interest in continuously learning new things<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Willingness to gain a good understanding of refining processes and the downstream market in Germany<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluent in English and German<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivaled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The purpose of this position is to set up and further develop Global H2 Mobility Product Quality Management processes and best practices to ensure assurance for H2 product quality in Mobility Operations covering the full supply chain from Loading Bays via Distribution to HRS and customer private premises.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the world gravitates towards greener mobility and zero emission transportation, Shell Emerging Energy Solutions works on several fronts to provide customers with various choices that will reduce their mobility carbon footprint. This is a unique opportunity to participate in the rapidly growing Hydrogen mobility space and enable delivery of safe, reliable, and cost-effective solutions via a structured Operations excellence strategy. There is an increasing demand for Hydrogen stations in Europe, especially since municipalities, countries and the European commission continue to introduce legislation mandating targets for decarbonization in the transportation sector.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As the H2 Product Quality Operations Excellence lead, you will have to set and deliver Operations standards for Product Quality management in H2 Mobility Operations and define the journey to operational excellence, setting baseline, targets for improvement, measuring of result, reporting on progress. Specifically, this will cover the following areas:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Overall management responsibility for set up and implementing of a H2 product quality assurance framework on global level, covering both H2 delivered via supplier as well as own produced and distributed H2<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain metrics to measure effectiveness, efficiency, value delivery, alignment to bus. goals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Stakeholder management (at management level and operations level) with suppliers, hauliers, customers, etc<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for E2E implementation of product Quality Management System (processes, tools)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Balance long term process maturation with short term PQ assurance requirements<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop processes for managing off spec product (information flow, product flow, (tank\u002Fpiping) capacity requirements, quality requirements, etc)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Leading role to analyze and resolve product quality incidents with root cause investigation and implementing learnings across<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop \u002F support LOD1 audits<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Preferred countries Netherlands, UK, France, Germany or virtual in Northwest EU and California.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from individuals with extensive experience in cross country or regional Product Quality Management ideally also with material technical exposure. You’ll also call on your Bachelor’s\u002FMaster’s degree in chemistry, chemical engineering or equivalent.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We also hope you possess the following skills or experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Extensive experience in Operations, Asset Management and \u002F or Road Transport<\u002Fli>\n   <li> In dept knowledge of quality assurance, laboratory, and analytical techniques, testing methods and sampling procedures<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in providing PQ support to customers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skill\u002Fmastery in identifying key (process) bottle necks \u002F issues, coordination of root cause analysis, development of actions plans, defining ownership and driving timely resolution<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Skill\u002Fmastery in (setting up) IT systems and tools (business model support and operations, manage (KPI) reporting)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Understanding and experience in standard processes, IT systems, IT platforms, digital solutions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Language skills: English; German and Dutch highly valued<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Nederland BV is a platform for international collaboration, with Shell offering direct employment to around ten thousand people in the Netherlands alone, including roughly 2,800 non-Dutch employees from around 80 countries. Diversity is key at Shell Nederland, and our employees reflect the innovation that stems from a diverse workforce. By joining Shell Nederland, you will benefit from an unrivalled industry-leading development programme that will see you tap into a pool of expert knowledge that will help propel your career. Shell Nederland is the holding company of most Shell companies operating in the Netherlands. Shell Nederland also has an advisory and coordinating role in numerous areas.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. stage, not just in Shell but also in the broader societal and corporate space. You will be working in a rapidly evolving business area, often in challenging regulatory and legal environments. You will be a part of a global and virtual team of capable and motivated individuals and as such, will benefit from the ability to work and form relationships with a diverse set of individuals. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Nature Based Solutions (NBS) comprise all activities related to the protection or restoration of natural ecosystems resulting in enhanced natural carbon sequestration, and the marketing, trading and sale of resulting carbon credits and other services and products. Shell is making a significant commitment NBS, rooted in the scientific evidence that points to the substantial near-term role nature can play in fighting climate change and the additional benefits that investment in nature can generate.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Strategically, NBS can (1) complement the delivery of Shell’s Net Carbon Footprint ambition and thus has a role to play in Shell thriving through the energy transition, (2) be a credible option to allow us to address the CO2 footprint of the consumption of the energy products we sell together with our customers, and (3) be an attractive investment in carbon sequestration at a time when the world is becoming increasingly carbon-constrained. To achieve this, Shell is driving voluntary and compliance demand development for high-integrity nature-based carbon credits, developing a large and competitive supply portfolio to serve our customers, and contributing to a supportive societal and policy context for NBS.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Technical Manager for Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA), you will play a key role in the technical and environmental assessment and maturation of opportunities in the EMEA region and will work with other technical managers and business developers in the NBS EMA team to ensure the development of a balanced portfolio that is robust from economic, carbon management, environmental and societal perspectives.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work with and support the NBS General Manager EMEA on the implementation of the EMEA NBS business development strategy including:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Originate and mature business opportunities that generate carbon credits from nature, together with commercial and technical team members<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manage technical elements of business opportunities across the NBS EMEA portfolio ensuring that Shell’s investments in carbon credits from nature are of high quality underpinned by robust science and industry certification standards<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead assessment of the technical value (including environmental; community stakeholder participation; measurement, reporting and verification (MRV)) of individual NBS project\u002F program opportunities across the EMEA region with a specific focus on Africa<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support and provide technical input and peer review for NBS projects in other regions as required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain a network of regional specific advisors, consultants and implementation partners to strengthen the EMEA portfolio of opportunities and the delivery thereof<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participate in and support engagements with industry fora, NGOs, governments and regulators regarding the carbon accounting, fiscal and regulatory treatment of NBS opportunities, aimed at securing and sustaining long-term development opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead and\u002For participate in the assessment of opportunities related to developing MRV standards, including with certification bodies and industry groups<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to speak with individuals with proven business development experience that includes first-hand experience in planning, screening, developing and managing nature-based carbon sequestration projects in agriculture- or forestry-based methodologies, including measurement, reporting and verification. You’ll also call on your Master’s degree in environmental sciences, agriculture, forestry management, agronomy or similar field.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We also hope you possess the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Highly skilled in carbon methodology implementation through first-hand project experience with certification bodies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rich understanding of key issues with carbon projects with experience in assessing project baselines, nesting mechanisms and NBS carbon accounting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Core knowledge of the areas relevant to NBS, including (agro-) forestry, carbon credit origination and trading, policy and regulations etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong relationship management skills and ability to gain trust and credibility quickly with a large number of internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business development and effective stakeholder engagement and relationship building experience in Africa is a key requirement<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An attention to detail, ensuring development of and adherence to robust systems that withstand external scrutiny<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An entrepreneurial, flexible, hands-on, can-do approach, with a willingness to step in and support a range of activities as the NBS business grows<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrable passion for nature and a solution-oriented interest in the energy transition<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position calls for a self-motivated, entrepreneurial and responsible individual with the proven ability to perform well under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future by investing in renewable energy and natural ecosystems and developing technology in new emerging energy supply and storage solutions that helps the world to use energy more cleanly and efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Für unser Team in Hamburg suchen wir Dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als <b>Rail Scheduler (m\u002Fw\u002Fd).<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Jobbeschreibung<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Trading &amp; Supply (T&amp;S) ist der Integrator und Optimierer für alle Versorgungsoptionen, Transportwege und Vertriebskanäle innerhalb der Shell Gruppe. Der Supply Bereich für DACH ist widerum in Products und Operations, ansässig in Rotterdam und Hamburg, aufgeteilt. Während sich der T&amp;S Products Bereich auf das Marketing und den Vertrieb der Shell Produkte konzentriert, ist der T&amp;S Operations Bereich für das Bestandsmanagement in den Raffinerien und Tanklägern, die Steuerung der Zu-und Verkaufsverträge sowie die Tankwagen- und Bahnlogistik, wo die ausgeschriebene Rolle angesiedelt ist, verantwortlich.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Verantwortlichkeiten<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Als Teil des Rail Transport Teams plant und überwacht der Rail Scheduler Zugtransporte zur Versorgung unserer Tankläger in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz (DACH) unter Beachtung der vertraglichen Rahmenbedingungen ebenso wie Einschränkungen z.B. durch Streckensperrungen mit dem Ziel, die Kesselwagenflotte möglichst effizient einzusetzen. Da es bei den Transporten, oft auch kurzfristig, zu Verspätungen oder Stronierungen kommt, muss die Zugplanung regelmäßig auf Basis der aktuellen Informationen in enger Abstimmung mit den Eisenbahnverkehrsunternehmen (EVU) sowie internen Stakeholdern angepasst werden. Darüber hinaus ist es Aufgabe des Rail Schedulers den EVUs regelmäßig Feedback zur operativen Performance sowie strukturellen Themen zu geben und bei der Vorbereitung von Performance Reviews zu unterstützen. Grundlage für die Arbeit im Rail Transport Team DACH ist die Einhaltung aller gesetzlichen Bestimmungen sowie Sicherheitsrichtlinien.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Das bringst Du mit<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Du hast eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium, bevorzugt im Bereich Supply Chain oder Logistik<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du konnstest mind. 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung, idealerweise im Bereich Logistik, sammeln<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du arbeitest auch unter Druck strukturiert, vorrausschauend und lösungsorientiert<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, Aufgaben zu priorisieren<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du kommunizierst effektiv, hast eine kommerzielles Denkweise und ein ausgeprägtes Verhandlungsgeschick<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du verfügst über verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und fließende Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du bist sicher im Umgang mit MS Office Anwendungen<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Das bieten wir dir:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Anspruchsvolle und spannende Aufgaben in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen, welches die Energiewende strategisch mitgestaltet<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Internationales Arbeitsumfeld<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Einen zukunftssicheren Job mit attraktiver Vergütung<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexibles und anteilig mobiles Arbeiten sowie 30 Tage Urlaub<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Umfangreiche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Der Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland ist einer der fünf Energie- und Chemieparks von Shell weltweit. Er besteht aus den beiden Standorten Süd (Wesseling) und Nord (Godorf) und hat ein großes Transformationsprogramm gestartet. Dabei werden die Standorte von einer Raffinerie- und Chemieanlage in einen Shell Energy and Chemicals Park der Zukunft umgewandelt. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Dieser erfüllt und unterstützt die Energiewendeziele von Shell und hat eine bedeutende Rolle bei der Energiewende deutschlandweit und insbesondere des Rheinischen Reviers in NRW.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Es gab noch nie eine aufregendere Zeit, um bei Shell zu arbeiten. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Jeder bei Shell trägt dazu bei, eine der größten Herausforderungen zu lösen, mit denen die Welt heute konfrontiert ist: die Vorteile der Energie für alle Menschen auf dem Planeten zu nutzen und gleichzeitig die Risiken des Klimawandels zu bewältigen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Kommen Sie zu uns und bringen Sie ihre Vorstellungskraft in ein Unternehmen ein, das die Macht hat, die Zukunft zu gestalten - sei es durch Investitionen in erneuerbare Energien, die Erforschung neuer Wege zur Energiespeicherung, die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff oder die Entwicklung von Technologien, die der Welt helfen, Energie effizienter zu nutzen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Für diesen dynamischen Standort suchen wir erfahrene neue Kollegen, die Ihre Karriere und den Standort entscheidend voranbringen möchten.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Senior Project Manager (m\u002Fw\u002Fd) <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Ihre Aufgaben:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Abwicklung mittlerer und großer kapitalintensiver Projekte innerhalb des vorgegebenen Zeitplans und unter Einhaltung aller Budgetvorgaben, Spezifikationen und Qualitätsstandards<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Vorbereitung, Planung und Ausführen von Projekten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Management und Steuerung von externen Dienstleistern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Produktion, Engineering und Technologie<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sicherstellung des frist- und budgetgerechten Abschlusses von Projekten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Einhaltung und Überwachung aller geforderten Sicherheitsstandards während des gesamten Projektablaufs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Master Studium im Bereich Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Leitung großer und komplexer Projekte im Industrieumfeld, vorzugsweise in der chemischen oder petrochemischen Industrie<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Erfahrung in der Führung von multidisziplinären Projektteams<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise geprägt durch Flexibilität, Selbstständigkeit und Engagement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Der Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland ist einer der fünf Energie- und Chemieparks von Shell weltweit. Er besteht aus den beiden Standorten Süd (Wesseling) und Nord (Godorf) und hat ein großes Transformationsprogramm gestartet. Dabei werden die Standorte von einer Raffinerie- und Chemieanlage in einen Shell Energy and Chemicals Park der Zukunft umgewandelt. Dieser erfüllt und unterstützt die Energiewendeziele von Shell und hat eine bedeutende Rolle bei der Energiewende deutschlandweit und insbesondere des Rheinischen Reviers in NRW.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Es gab noch nie eine aufregendere Zeit, um bei Shell zu arbeiten. Jeder bei Shell trägt dazu bei, eine der größten Herausforderungen zu lösen, mit denen die Welt heute konfrontiert ist: die Vorteile der Energie für alle Menschen auf dem Planeten zu nutzen und gleichzeitig die Risiken des Klimawandels zu bewältigen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Komm zu uns und Du wirst Dein Talent und Deine Vorstellungskraft in ein Unternehmen einbringen, das die Macht hat, die Zukunft zu gestalten - sei es durch Investitionen in erneuerbare Energien, die Erforschung neuer Wege zur Energiespeicherung, die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff oder die Entwicklung von Technologien, die der Welt helfen, Energie effizienter zu nutzen. Für diesen dynamischen Standort suchen wir erfahrene neue Kollegen, die Ihre Karriere und den Standort entscheidend voranbringen möchten.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Treibe die Transformationsreise mit uns an!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Ingenieur (m\u002Fw\u002Fd) im Bereich <\u002Fb><b>Elektrotechnik<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <p><b> Deine Aufgaben<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <ul>\n    <li><p> Verantwortlicher Ingenieur für die Planung und Umsetzung der globalen Strategie im Shell Energy and Chemicals Park.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Zusammenarbeit mit einem internationalen Team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Teilnahme an nationalen und internationalen Meetings mit dem Team als auch mit dem Lieferanten.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Zuständig für die Abwicklung von betriebsnahen Projekten, von der Konzeptentwicklung bis zur technischen Umsetzung sowie Abnahme und Inbetriebnahme.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Koordination der externen Ressourcen und Kontraktoren übernehmen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Durchführung der Vergabe von Engineering- und Montage-Leistungen an interne oder externe Dienstleister und deren Abnahme.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Erstellung von Spezifikationen für Elektrische Einrichtungen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Implementierung und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung der anzuwendenden Regelwerke, Normen und Verfahrensanweisungen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Sicherstellung der Anlagenverfügbarkeit durch Ausarbeitung von zukunftsorientierten E-Konzepten Mitwirkung an den Sicherheitsbetrachtungen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Leitung von spannenden zukunftsorientierte Energieprojekte im Bereich der Elektrotechnik.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <li><p> Erstellung und Weiterentwicklung von technischen Standards und Regelwerken im Bereich Elektrotechnik<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik, Energietechnik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Mehrjährige Projekterfahrung bei der Planung von E- oder MSR Projekten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Weiterführende Zertifikate wie z.B. Blitzschutzfachkraft oder befähigte Person sekundärer elektrischer Explosionsschutz<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Expertenkenntnisse der Produkte und Systeme der Energietechnik<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kenntnisse im Bereich der elektrischen Stromversorgung und Verteilung.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute Kenntnisse relevanter Normen der VDE und ihrer landesspezifischen Umsetzungen sowie anderer relevanter Standards, Gesetzen und Verordnungen bringen Sie mit (z.B. VDE, Ex-Schutz, Betriebssicherheitsverordnung)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Erfahrungen im Bereich der Netzberechnung wünschenswert<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Erfahrung in der Führung von multidisziplinären Projektteams wünschenswert<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute MS Office-Kenntnisse können Sie ebenso vorweisen wie verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Umfangreiche Erfahrungen in den EMSR relevanten CAE und Dokumentationssystemen wünschenswert<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise ist mit hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein für Qualität, Termine und Kosten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kooperations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit mit interkulturelle Kompetenz<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Interessiert?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Hast Du Lust in einer der 5 weltweiten Shell Energy and Chemicals Parks an den Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu arbeiten?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Take an active role in the development of future mobility solutions and products for Shell's Advanced Fuel, Lubricant, E-Mobility, Energy &amp; Hydrogen business: Join the Future Mobility, Energy &amp; Industrial Applications Testing Group (PTX\u002FT) at Shell Technology Centre Hamburg as an <b>R&amp;D Engineer – Vehicle Testing (m\u002Ff\u002Fd)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The Future Mobility, Energy &amp; Industrial Applications Testing group consists of seven collaborative laboratories that work hand in hand to develop future energy, lubricant &amp; mobility solutions. Reporting to the Future Mobility, Energy &amp; Industrial Applications Testing Manager, this role provides specialist engineering expertise to the experimental Chassis Dynamometer Laboratory team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> The <b>R&amp;D Engineer - Vehicle Testing (m\u002Ff\u002Fd)<\u002Fb> is responsible to provide project leadership and hands-on guidance to a team of engineers, experimentalists &amp; technicians which is researching and developing future fuels, lubricants and mobility solutions.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Daily tasks will include providing project leadership and hands-on guidance to a local team of experimentalists &amp; technicians. The role is responsible for defining test schedules, project scopes, writing reports and preparing technical presentations for stakeholders, management and external partners as well as ensuring that experimental requests are delivered safely, accurately, on-time &amp; on budget. In addition to these project related tasks, the R&amp;D Engineer - Vehicle Testing (m\u002Ff\u002Fd) is responsible for improving test methods and procedures, for mentoring colleagues and to help grow the technical expertise in the organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills plus excellent English and German verbal and written language skills (minimum B2 level) are required. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p>A Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering and experience in vehicle testing and project management is required. However, applicants with equivalent combinations of education and comparable or transferrable technical experience and project management exposure are welcome to apply.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Expert knowledge of experimental methods in the field of vehicle technology and combustion engines is essential. This includes knowledge of engine and transmission technology, exhaust aftertreatment solutions, vehicle emission legislation, related safety equipment, test procedures, measurement equipment, calibration, and test automation techniques. In-depth knowledge in combustion science, alternative fuels, battery solutions and EV technology as well as Engine Control Units and Battery Management Systems is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of operational and process safety, HSSE and Quality Management is required. Prior experience with processes like ISO9001 and ISO17025 is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated prior experience and a successful track record of working in a collaborative R&amp;D environment and delivery on time and on budget is expected.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A solid track record of intercultural stakeholder management skills, a learner mindset combined with a natural curiosity as well as a dynamic and collaborative work approach is required.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge in Agile project management methods, Systems Thinking and Model Based Systems Engineering is a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivalled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest refinery operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic E-Mobility Application Scientist (m\u002Ff\u002Fd) to join the global E-Mobility Application Team.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is developing into a leader in electric mobility and is deploying its global network of chargers for electric vehicles, covering the whole range of charging equipment from AC chargers at home to high power chargers at Shell forecourts in one ecosystem, with a goal of 500,000 Shell operated charge points by 2025.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Our E-Mobility Application team supports the technology development of attractive E- Mobility offers with an emphasis upon developing new and innovative options; nurturing the understanding of the scientific and mechanistic aspects of work undertaken, with the goal of closing technology gaps, providing new technology insights, and generating tangible product options; generating IP and business value for the global Mobility business through our Shell Recharge brand.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Potential candidates will be part of the global team located in Hamburg, Shanghai, Houston, and London.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As an E-Mobility Application Scientist you will be responsible for:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> The development of new advanced and smart charging solutions, which will enable Shell to be a profitable player in E-Mobility, e.g. V2X, inductive charging, AC\u002FDC standards<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The technical foundation of the rollout of Shell’s charging infrastructure in key markets (US, China, EU)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Global e-mobility research and development and technical service projects, working with different Shell businesses<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working externally with OEMs, suppliers, and universities, as our E-Mobility network is growing fast and needs further expansion<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Driving opportunities for commercialization of new technology by applying creativity and innovative thinking<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Working to high Health, Safety, and Environmental standard and encouraging the same in others<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Hold a Master’s Degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering or related disciplines with relevant experience in electric mobility and project management. Applicants with equivalent combinations of education and experience in electric mobility and project management are also welcomed to apply<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in developing e-mobility charging solutions, including communication protocols, charger technology, safety equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge in vehicle technology, battery systems, micro grid and home energy applications is a plus<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in intercultural stakeholder management, a learner mindset combined with a natural curiosity as well as a dynamic and collaborative work approach is required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills plus excellent German and English verbal and written language skills (minimum B2 level) are required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Shell is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic C&amp;P Lead Mobility DACH to join our Contracting &amp; Procurement (C&amp;P) Team in Hamburg. The multi-national Team collaborates across several locations and performs all strategic and tactical contracting and procurement activities for the Mobility Business Unit which operates Shell’s Petrol Station and Electric Vehicle Charging (EV) network in the DACH region.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Incumbent of this role will negotiate and manage several strategic and tactical contracts which includes contracting of EPCM &amp; Maintenance services, Real Estate services, Equipment, and negotiations of strategic partnerships. Besides performing tenders and contract negotiations, the role will require strong focus on post award contract and claims management.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role plays an integral part in Shell Mobility DACH as incumbent directly contributes our ambitions to grow our network and become the Number 1 provider of EV solutions, increase sustainability within the supply chain and making Shell the Partner of Choice within the Mobility Ecosystem of the Future.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-moving environment with several growth projects taking place, builds effective working relationships and can prioritise multiple projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specific responsibilities include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Develop &amp; execute commercially competitive contracting &amp; procurement strategies for Shell Mobility DACH which meet the Business Demand while considering potential implementation of Global Strategies at local\u002Fregional level<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Conduct tenders, evaluate bids &amp; drive negotiations with Suppliers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Build and perform a Post Award Contract Management to ensure delivery of maximum value through each of the awarded contracts\u002Fcommercial deals including claims management<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Implementation of robust Contractor Safety Management practices and alignment to Shell’s personal and process safety Goal Zero focus areas in close liaison with Contract Managers\u002FHolders and Owners<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure continuous decarbonization of our supply chain in close collaboration with suppliers<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proactively identify &amp; understand commercial\u002Fprocurement needs from internal business partners (Shell Mobility DACH Business) and collaboratively propose competitive solutions This may involve constructively challenging the Business Demand and\u002For Procurement Practices to drive value and efficiency for the organization<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Manage Supplier Relationship effectively and collaboratively drive continuous performance improvement via relevant contract key metrics (Eg: HSSE, Operations, Cost). This involves constructively challenging the Suppliers in terms of the contract delivery and performance<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Build and maintain a strong network in the market, being fully aware of supplier developments and opportunities coming up in the market<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensure strong connect across the wider C&amp;P Organization (Eg: Downstream, Functions &amp; Technology, Centre of Excellence) to ensure continuous cross sharing and leveraging of best practices<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide coaching, support, and guidance to other team members to ensure delivery of results where possible<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Minimum of bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Business, Law or related field<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record of extensive Contracting &amp; Procurement experience is required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in drafting and managing contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record in dealing and negotiation with third parties incl. incentivized contracts<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven track record of execution excellence &amp; delivering results, e.g through active contract management or CI Projects<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with SAP ARIBA is considered a plus<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Highly tuned commercial acumen and curiosity with demonstrated ability to develop and deliver value from complex deals<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of strategic, technical, legal, finance, taxation, and commercial issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High interest in contract negotiations &amp; complex tender evaluation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to articulate in an organized and precise manner<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Self-starter - able to work and solve problems under own initiative<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal, influencing &amp; stakeholder management skills<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluent in both German and English language<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivalled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest refinery operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Er besteht aus den beiden Standorten Süd (Wesseling) und Nord (Godorf) und hat ein großes Transformationsprogramm gestartet. Dabei werden die Standorte von einer Raffinerie- und Chemieanlage in einen Shell Energy and Chemicals Park der Zukunft umgewandelt. Dieser erfüllt und unterstützt die Energiewendeziele von Shell und hat eine bedeutende Rolle bei der Energiewende deutschlandweit und insbesondere des Rheinischen Reviers in NRW.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Es gab noch nie eine aufregendere Zeit, um bei Shell zu arbeiten. Jeder bei Shell trägt dazu bei, eine der größten Herausforderungen zu lösen, mit denen die Welt heute konfrontiert ist: die Vorteile der Energie für alle Menschen auf dem Planeten zu nutzen und gleichzeitig die Risiken des Klimawandels zu bewältigen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> Komm zu uns und Du wirst Dein Talent und Deine Vorstellungskraft in ein Unternehmen einbringen, das die Macht hat, die Zukunft zu gestalten - sei es durch Investitionen in erneuerbare Energien, die Erforschung neuer Wege zur Energiespeicherung, die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff oder die Entwicklung von Technologien, die der Welt helfen, Energie effizienter zu nutzen. Für diesen dynamischen Standort suchen wir erfahrene neue Kollegen, die Ihre Karriere und den Standort entscheidend voranbringen möchten.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Treibe die Transformationsreise mit uns an!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Lead Engineer Static Equipment and Inspection (m\u002Fw\u002Fd)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> Deine Aufgaben:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Verantwortlicher Ingenieur für Neubau und Umbauprojekte im Bereich statisches Equipment und Inspektion.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Arbeit in einem internationalen Team zur Entwicklung der Anlagen der Zukunft für den Shell Energy and Chemical Park Rheinland.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Spezifikation und Auswahl von Druckgeräten innerhalb von Investitionsprojekten der Energy Transition.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Management und Steuerung von externen Dienstleistern.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Technische Fachexpertise im Bereich Materialauswahl, Auswahl und Berechnung von Druckbehältern und Rohrleitungen inklusive Lebenszykluskosten bis hin zur Auswahl und Durchführung von Abnahme- und Inbetriebnahme-Inspektionen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entwickeln und begleiten von Qualitätssicherungsmaßnahmen, um eine reibungslose Projektentwicklung, Equipment Herstellung bis hin zum späteren Betrieb und Instandhaltung zu erreichen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entwicklung von modernen Überwachungskonzepten auf Basis der Digitalisierung und Automatisierung der Anlagen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der Produktions-, Projektleitungs- und Technologie Abteilung.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b><br> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes technisches Studium z.B. im Bereich Maschinenbau.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Mehrjährige (3 - 5 Jahre) Berufserfahrung.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kenntnisse der einschlägigen Regelwerke wie AD2000, EN13480, EN1591, deutsche Gesetzgebung und der Druckgeräterichtlinie.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Erfahrung in der Abnahme, Aufstellung und Inbetriebnahme von Druckbehältern und Rohrleitungen.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entwicklung und Unterstützung von Methoden zur Digitalisierung und künstlicher Intelligenz zur Ausrüstungsüberwachung.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise geprägt durch Flexibilität, Selbstständigkeit und ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Interessiert?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Hast Du Lust in einer der 5 weltweiten Shell Energy and Chemicals Parks an den Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu arbeiten?<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a member of Chemicals, Products &amp; Site Operations (CPSO SOM) at Shell, the chosen candidate will have the opportunity to work in a challenging but rewarding environment that is fast paced and changing fundamentally as Shell transforms its business to meet the ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, whilst delivering a world class business case that has a strong societal license to operate. The candidate will be expected to enact change and deliver value globally across business lines and geographies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Delivery Manager role is dedicated for end-to-end project delivery at the Rheinland Energy &amp; Chemical Park in Germany. Taking accountability for delivery performance, meeting customer expectations, and driving future project demand. Delivery Managers plan, execute, and control a project or set of related projects to meet identified business requirements and deliver business value, through acquiring and utilizing the necessary resources and skills, within agreed parameters of cost, timescales, risk, quality and benefits.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Accountabilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Agree and deliver a body of work, organised into programmes, projects and workstreams to agreed time, cost, quality, risk and benefit profiles, delivered within Shell's standards and controls framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proactively analyse variances against plan to assess trends threatening agreed scope, time, cost, and quality commitments. Identify signs that a project may be at risk and take appropriate action.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage internal and external stakeholders such as users, customers or suppliers to fully benefit from the delivered products, services and changes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and execute appropriate change and engagement plans to achieve necessary behaviour changes in order to maximise benefits.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Align expectations and ensure that the decision-making of stakeholders happen in a timely and effective manner.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Mobilize and lead teams composed of a mixture of staff and suppliers across organisational boundaries and the natural team. Ensure they have the necessary skills, capacity and experience to achieve the required outcomes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop the skills of team members through coaching, delegation and providing stretching assignments.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand, assess and embed the right delivery methodologies, considering project and business constraints.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Assess programme risks as they are encountered and evaluate trade-offs between cost, time, quality, risk and ultimately benefit, continuously managing the business cases of constituent projects and workstreams.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that all deliverables, whether software, hardware, processes, products or business change are fit for purpose, meet all relevant requirements and are effectively transitioned to support and business-as-usual.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure that the business value intended by the work is explicit, agreed and delivered.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Plan, execute, monitor, control, and close all aspects of the project lifecycle.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Quickly build and leverage relationships with sponsors, the Programme Manager, key stakeholders and understand their priorities. Resolve conflict and deliver tough messages with grace to the Decision Review Board.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Agree and build an agreed list of deliverables as defined by the Decision Review Board or Programme Manager, keeping to the time, cost and quality parameters set.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Motivate and lead the project or workstream team through periods of uncertainty, while understanding and reporting barriers so that the team can complete its objectives while managing pressure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Create and deliver relevant and impactful communications for project or workstream stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the project team to remain resilient after setbacks and to recover performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage and report risks at a project level to make timely recommendations that will maximize value.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand changes necessary to balance execution efficiency with risk mitigation, value delivery, cost, quality and benefits.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand programme or project goals and business context at all stages of the lifecycle, and particularly when responding to challenges and change. Recommend acceptable courses of action where appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute the chosen methodology for the project or workstream to maximise delivery effectiveness.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute the required governance approach defined by the Decision Review Board or Programme Manager.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support programme leadership or the natural team to enable the project team to collaborate effectively with business IT, the impacted businesses, wider stakeholders both internally and externally, resolving issues such as financing, risk, resourcing, integrated planning and long-term management of any resulting products and services where appropriate.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We hope to see the following in your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> 5+ years in IT with 3+ years of experience in managing projects through the entire lifecycle (start up to close down).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Degree educated with evidence of a commitment to lifelong learning.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Program and Project Delivery skills in both Agile and waterfall methodologies.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Domain knowledge and skills in Chemicals and products, Finance, Legal, HR, and Capital Project lines of business and functions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Technology skills, such as cloud, mobile, software-as-a-service, and digital platforms.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Professional skills, such as leadership, communication and resilience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entrepreneurial skills, such as a business-value mindset, critical thinking, storytelling, stakeholder management, and enabling value creation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Projects with multiple workstreams and deliverables, impacting a collection of business processes or teams, with business and technical change. Impacts a single function or team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attained, or working towards PMP® certification and agile certification.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Expected to work onsite for at least 3 days a week.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Native German speaker.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in English, spoken and written.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivalled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest refinery operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>We are looking for an experienced <b>Labour Relations Advisor (m\u002Ff\u002Fd)<\u002Fb> to join our Germany Employee and Industrial Relations (ER\u002FIR) team. The position will be based at our <b>Energy &amp; Chemicals Park Rheinland <\u002Fb>near Cologne. In this challenging role you will be building and sustaining constructive ER\u002FIR relationships and a healthy ER\u002FIR climate as well as a safe work environment in compliance with local requirements. In addition, you will ensure business continuity, defend our license to operate and provide - as required - expertise on a broad variety of topics such as litigations, Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestment activities and global projects.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your key accountabilities will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Single Point Accountability for Employee Relations and Employee Engagement for the designated area of business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage local consultation processes and requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage external risks and ensure compliance with external legislative requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide country specific subject matter expert ER\u002FIR advice<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Act as trusted advisor and offer coaching for front line Line Managers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and leverage relationship with internal Employee Representative bodies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Run proactive interventions aimed at improving quality of leadership\u002F employee engagement through line managers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Execute Germany-specific culture and work environment programmes incl. health and welfare<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Drive and support an inclusive workforce and the overall D&amp;I agenda for Business and Site.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage high-impact or high-risk individual or collective disciplinary, grievance or other ER\u002FIR issues incl. HSSE, Compliance &amp; Ethics<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support local crisis management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sense what goes on in the organization and anticipate what topics can grow into grievances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead HR investigations, GHL complaints and other grievances<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure duty of care towards employees and contractors (worker welfare) capability and community building<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ensure robust information &amp; knowledge management relating to Germany specific ER\u002FIR content<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaborate with HR Expertise to ensure good solid knowledge of Labor Practices standards internally and keeping up to date with the external news and development<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coach HR Advisors and Line Managers on quality ER, Ethics &amp; Compliance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University level qualification<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven HR experience gained in the fields of employee engagement, industrial relations and complex case management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deep subject matter expertise in country-specific ER\u002FIR legislation, regulations, directives, practices and processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deep subject matter expertise in country-specific employee representative processes including CLAs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to identify and understand local external market trends (economic, political, social) and derive insights to drive effective a long-term ER\u002FIR environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Organizational health\u002Fcapability diagnostic and design skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to distill key themes and value drivers from complex and sometimes conflicting data and insights<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong influencing skills to effectively manage a broad range of both external and internal stakeholders including 3rd party bodies and government agencies<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Collaboration and integrative leadership (with other parts of the HR organization)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Languages required: German &amp;
