support to HR staff, aligned to global\u002Flocal HR strategy and policies. Contributing to a competitive Employee Value Proposition it develops new policies\u002Fbenefits and recommends changes of existing ones to respond to shifting market needs, embracing trends and enhancing attractiveness for diverse generations as well as flexibility\u002Fagility. Moreover, you will be:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Reviewing policies\u002Fbenefits to ensure compliance to local law\u002Fregulation and enabling HR digitalization\u002Fautomation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Actively contributing to the implementation of further Workday releases by analyzing local requirements, looking for improvement opportunities, populating workbook content, supporting decisions on configuration, testing and consultation as well as managing change with focus on implementation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting local CI activities to support simplification and standardization in HR policy and processes; thus providing opportunities for a more value adding HR contribution to the business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for developing new and maintaining\u002Fadjusting existing policies for Germany supporting the business and people agenda aligned with global direction<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Taking external trends and new requirements pro-actively into account and think employee back with (internal) customer focus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> as the IT enabler for world class and global HR processes, closely collaborating with global\u002Fexternal Workday project teams and across HR departments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Monitoring and evaluating the impact of (potential) changes in German regulations or law<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Revising policies as needed based on new laws and requirements and business requests<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Supporting appropriate and effective consultation with (Central) Staff Council in the area of policies and benefits in collaboration with Employee and in HR policy and process<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing complex and sensitive issues with potential tension between HR and Business, local and global requirements, driving compliance and <li><p> Fluent command of both English and German, written and spoken<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Workday and HR SAP experience of advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivalled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest refinery operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>An exciting opportunity to contribute in Shell’s ambitions in offering lower carbon energy while supporting one of the largest energy commodity portfolios in Europe. Here’s a chance to apply your analytical skills and improve your trading understanding to a role where you’ll have every opportunity to grow your professional experience and make your mark.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As an integral part of Shell’s Integrated Power Strategy, Shell Energy (SE) and Renewables and Energy Solutions (R&amp;ES) have the ambition to substantially grow its European Business to business(B2B)\u002F Commercial and industrial C&amp;I Gas and Power supply and sales business across European countries.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> For that purpose, SE and R&amp;ES have established a commercial business (R&amp;ES Europe B2B Retail) under the newly created European VP-ship in R&amp;ES which will provide energy commodities (gas &amp; power, off-sets) and energy solutions to B2B and Commercial and Industrial customers. This business inherits the significant portfolio of C&amp;I customers previously served under Shell Energy and will expand it in terms of customers, volumes, countries and solutions offered.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Supply &amp; Portfolio Team is an integral part to this strategy and will enable Shell to capture more and new opportunities in the country markets, by focusing specifically on the growth of the B2B and C&amp;I Customers Portfolio, ensuring its monitoring while managing its performance.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>As the Germany Supply &amp; Portfolio Analyst, you will support the S&amp;P Manager in the optimization and management of the consolidated commodity positions of all the customers across the country that your team operates in.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be responsible for tracking the exposures on a daily basis, that will be the basis for the hedging strategies that the S&amp;P Manager will put in place together with the Traders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will also provide inputs to structure the best and most competitive supply solution to enable the local B2B\u002FC&amp;I organization to grow the customers portfolio and to maximize the value for the Shell Group.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Furthermore, your accountabilities are as follows:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Interface with the Germany S&amp;P Manager as well as local Sales Team, Operations and Finance department<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Partner with Portfolio Management team across Europe to ensure best cross-country collaboration.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Administer Deal Entry, Entry Adjustments and Exposure Update.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Monitor the broader value of the customer, including extrinsic, cross-commodity, cross-service, and lifetime cycle.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support the Germany S&amp;P with market intelligence and analysis that can lead to hedging strategies to protect the profitability of the portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Follow Market regulation and provide support in analysing the impacts on the portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide input in shaping and support IT and process capability build for managing exposures and to digitally automate the transactions between Markets and Trading and between Markets and Customers<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to hear from individuals who have experience in handling sales portfolio. Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Good knowledge of European Energy markets, with particular focus on the German markets gas and power.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good knowledge of physical trading and settlement.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good understanding of risks and exposures.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong analytical skills and relationship skills, along with an entrepreneurial mindset<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good attitude at problem solving with innovative solutions and independency in organizing the tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Beneficial strong technology and coding skills coupled with knowledge of data science (eg Python, SQL)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Beneficial quantitative background, ideally Bsc\u002FMsc in Math’s, Engineering or Science based degree<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluency in the English and German language.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At Shell Germany, our drive is to employ world-class individuals. We employ 4,200 people whose careers have benefited from our industry-leading career development programme and unrivaled inhouse access to local and global experts. We are active in many areas such as Gas, Gas Marketing, Manufacturing &amp; Distribution of oil products, Petrochemicals as well as Research &amp; Development. Shell in Germany is one of the biggest retailers of energy products and one of the largest refinery operators. Our extensive R&amp;D facilities in Hamburg allow us to offer a broad range of expertise on Retail Fuels, Lubes, and Marine, Power and Engine Vehicle Technology. Shell began operations in Germany in 1902.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Regulatory Affairs Manager Gas<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for market design and a commercial mindset this could be your chance to make a difference in the gas industry. You will play a key role in growing the Shell integrated gas businesses by shaping the German regulatory framework and advising business developers, traders and the B2B team on commercial positions on gas.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The EU and German gas regulatory frameworks are rapidly evolving in response to the challenging security of supply and energy transition agenda. Understanding the complex regulatory environment in Germany and in the EU, translating regulations into winning and defensive commercial structures, influencing the shaping up of new policies and regulations affecting the gas value chains will be key success factors for Shell to outcompete others in the market and deliver on its growth ambitions. You will report into the North West Europe Gases Team Lead and become a key part of our SE and RES Regulatory Team, a team of regulatory experts who are passionate about:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> delivering value for Shell by identifying key regulatory risks and mitigating strategies to protect Shell’s existing and aspired commercial positions,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> developing opportunities to change existing regulations to enable business growth and<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> actively pursuing and delivering regulatory change by playing a thought leadership role in external regulatory processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Commercial and Regulatory Affairs Manager for Gas for the German market, you are going to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Monitor national authorities on policy, regulatory and market design issues having a commercial impact on our business<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop insights into the German gas market regulatory and market design structures and trends, with a particular focus on wholesale markets, LNG, security of supply, gas transport issues and B2B<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Use this knowledge to derive and facilitate commercial strategies to generate tangible financial results in the short, medium term and long term<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop insights on competitors and key market participants’ regulatory positions to help Shell identify future opportunities and threats<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Engage with commercial and functional teams, including the Trading and BD Gas teams in London and the local sales office in Germany and the local operations teams, to develop joint views on regulatory and market design opportunities, risks and threats<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leveraging on your professional regulatory network, develop and execute influencing and advocacy strategies both at the national level to secure value protection, new opportunities and business growth; lease with our local Corporate Relations team and work with them on political level advocacy<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Represent Shell in relevant trade and industry associations and their committees and working groups. This will likely involve external leadership roles, e.g. committee chair<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Particularly for new business activities or customer value propositions, provide support to the business in identifying relevant rules and regulations and establishing efficient and effective processes so that business is conducted in full compliance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role has a significant requirement for external engagements, including regulatory authorities, TSOs, energy exchanges, academics and other industry players. A strong external focus, an ability to network and develop relationships, as well as diplomatic skills are required.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> At times you will work on formal consultations with a large amount of complex material that can be quite academic in nature with an aim to develop comprehensive Shell responses. You will need to distill the information, grasp the commercial concept, build a compelling argument and execute effective advocacy and lobbying. This entails communicating messages with confidence and credibility.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Attention to details is always a must and commercial acumen a necessity. You will be a self-starter, able to initiate new opportunities from a broadly defined set of objectives, meet\u002Fexceed performance targets and motivate others to do likewise.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Also, we are interested in attracting people who share our core working values of honesty, integrity and respect for others and we seek professionals who can build on our business vision, are prepared to accept accountability and can achieve great results through teamwork.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We expect you to hold:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A Degree in one of the following disciplines: economics, engineering, law, political sciences<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sound knowledge of European gas markets and significant experience of the changing regulatory, commercial, customer and competitor playing field in the gas industry in Germany<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in written and spoken English and German essential<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in Trading or Business Development is an advantage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The Process Engineer provides technical support and leadership to the Hydroformylation and Ethoxylation (HFE) operations module.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The following are the primary accountabilities for the Process Engineer:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide technical oversight of the site’s process operations<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Define and implement Safe Operating Limits<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical direction for HSSE-MS activities (PHA, Corrosion control reviews, Investigations, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform technical assurance of changes (MOC’s)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead Process Safety improvement initiatives<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assure timely completion of assigned action items from HSSE-MS activities (PHA, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Conduct proactive technical monitoring to support Operations in meeting targets for Safety, Environmental Compliance, Quality Assurance, Reliability, and Utilization.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform process unit optimization to improve energy usage, cost, and margin delivery<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Perform advanced troubleshooting and root cause analysis<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide process engineering support for successful implementation of unit outages and catalyst changes<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and lead improvement projects to increase margin, efficiency and\u002For HSE activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead efforts to leverage digital tools and other innovation efforts to enhance process safety and margin improvement<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical support of operations activities with technical, maintenance, and HSE departments (first technical point of contact for run and maintain issues)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Respond to urgent and critical operational related items at the request of the Operations Staff<\u002Fli>\n   <li> This position must be available to provide some level of support 24\u002F7 via phone call or other technology, and off hours callouts are sometimes required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participate in audits as needed to maintain compliance with state &amp; federal requirements, as well as local and corporate standards<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Assure complete documentation of key technical work<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Serve as a unit representative on site-wide teams as required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Be a change leader on projects. This includes leading the project during scouting to concept stages while providing technical support for the duration of the project<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide technical support and guidance to the Unit Master Plan efforts and the Geismar Expansion Organization<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Dimensions:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This position interfaces with stakeholders at all levels of the Geismar Chemical Plant.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Interpersonal skills, leadership skills, and ability to manage multiple interfaces with varying needs and priorities are critical to success in this position.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Understand impact of decisions on production, operability, safety, reliability and economics.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role reports to a Process Engineering Supervisor within the Technology Department at the Geismar Chemical Plant.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Geismar Chemical is a stand-alone Chemical Plant in the USA, and accounts for nearly half of Chemicals business results. Geismar has a long-term growth strategy and future growth projects. We leverage Shell proprietary technology to produce Ethylene Oxide, Ethylene Glycol, Alpha Olefins, Alcohols, Ethoxylates.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Must have legal authorization to work in the US on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering is required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Minimum three (3) years relevant experience in refining\u002Fpetrochemical industry. Technical experience in hydroformylation and ethoxylation process technologies, and process engineering experience providing direct support to manufacturing operations desired.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge and application of safety methodology and reviews (Process Hazards Analysis, Layers of Protection Analysis, etc.), including safeguarding.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience with plant changes and Management of Change process.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> The individual must be proficient in the use of spreadsheets, computer and simulation models.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Preferred Technology Competencies: Hydroformylation<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Must have a TWIC card or ability to get one<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemicals companies with over 90,000 employees in more than 70 countries and territories. In the US, we have operated for over a century and are a major oil and gas producer onshore and in the Gulf of Mexico, a recognized innovator in exploration and production technology, and a leading manufacturer and marketer of fuels, natural gas and petrochemicals. We deliver energy responsibly; operate safely with respect to our neighbours and work to minimize our environmental impact. We are in search of remarkable people who will thrive in a diverse and inclusive work environment to deliver exciting projects locally and globally. People who are passionate about exploring new frontiers. Innovators and pioneers. People with the drive to help shape our future. Because remarkable people achieve remarkable things.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential…<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>This is an exciting opportunity for you to lead the Offshore Wind Electrical Engineering team wherein you will be overseeing and delivering technical expertise in EC&amp;I engineering to the offshore wind projects and opportunities. <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell is growing its Renewable Generation and offshore wind portfolio through development of new business opportunities or buy into projects and operating assets. Particularly in NW Europe, the market is increasing in size and competitiveness. With this maturation, the landscape is changing and will require a fresh look on project development, both technically and commercially. A key part of this development is Shells capability in EC&amp;I engineering, where new approaches, designs and technology developments are continuous and developments strive to improve efficiency, drive down cost and reduce HSE risk. The offshore windsupply market is highly competitive and evolving and a key part of the role will further develop Shell’s relationship on technical aspects within the supply chain, in collaboration with C&amp;P.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role will consist of developing and overseeing the electrical team lead activities as well as supporting offshore wind projects and opportunities where required. You will be setting strategic direction for the team, implement processes and ways of working in close cooperation with the rest of the technical offshore wind team and other interfaces, within the offshore wind and Renewable Generation organization and relevant discipline engineering pools.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The EC&amp;I engineering team will deliver support for projects globally in all phases of the project lifecycle. You will work closely with the R&amp;D team to exchange on future technologies and implementation of those. You will set up and implement fit for purpose processes (like approach to specifications, assurance, ways of working, technical due diligence), be responsible for capturing and distributing lessons learnt between projects and regions and set standardization. You are responsible to develop the team and capability to support the business needs, having a strong focus on care for people and their development. You will furthermore work with the other technical leads together with the manager technical engineering in shaping and implementing the strategy for offshore wind in the technical space.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will act as technical authority in EC&amp;I Engineering for the various projects in role of sponsor or assurance reviewer ensuring highest level of risk reduction, raising concerns, bringing in Shell knowledge to JV’s and capturing lessons to further improve. You will also work closely with the relevant suppliers &amp; build relationships in the industry together with C&amp;P.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition to team lead duties, you can expect to be working on projects where you will lead selected engineering scope for projects and opportunities, driving for best value results from the technical concept and design safely, on time, on budget and to the required specifications and quality standards focusing on maximizing the safe efficient revenue from the asset over the life of the project.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> As team lead:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Establish, lead, and manage and being responsible for overseeing the activities &amp; health of the EC&amp;I Engineering team on global scale for offshore wind<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Defining and implementing the strategy for EC&amp;I Engineering considering shell strategy, market developments &amp; requirements (local content, circularity, low cost, etc.), supply chain developments, technology innovations, improvements, and lessons learnt in alignment with stakeholders, leveraging shells unique selling points as innovation and wider technology knowledge &amp; tools where it makes sense<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Provide (highest) technical assurance for respective disciplines in Offshore wind for the global offshore wind portfolio<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Act as main technical focal point towards strategic partners &amp; supply chain in EC&amp;I Engineering. Experience &amp; extensive network in the industry are key<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Oversee and drive approach to EC&amp;I Engineering technical due diligence activities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible to establish, implement and continuously improve team ways of working (systems, processes, instruments, resources, and standards like employer requirements to reduce LCOE, increase safety &amp; quality, increase efficiency and maximize value)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Own EC&amp;I Engineering technical development projections in support of bids, in close collaboration with key business stakeholders, (technical innovation, LCOE, C&amp;P, Project Services.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Resourcing (globally and in respective countries, in line with project and JV requirements, capability building and responsible for setting up and implementing development of team members to meet current &amp; future business requirements)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsibility for optimal coordination and allocation of respective engineering resources and support for offshore wind projects and opportunities globally<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Alignment and overall management responsibilities on interfaces and strategic alignment with the other discipline engineering \u002F technical teams and FEDM teams in offshore wind. Key focal point and center of expertise for internal requests on specific discipline questions<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Key counterpart for global discipline heads in respective discipline and develop competency matrices, career paths, and alignment with wider shell organization (in particular P&amp;T)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support Operational Projects and act as focal point for respective discipline for second line technical support (e.g. component repair &amp; replacements, asset integrity support)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fixed &amp; Floating wind projects, globally<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Safety for design Programs, competitive scoping, and pushing further improvement programs to professionalize the approach and EC&amp;I Engineering team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Maintain strong links &amp; alignment with other technical functions, (WTG, Offshore structureswind resource &amp; yield team, T&amp;I, O&amp;M, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to speak from individuals with relevant technical work experience within the wind and\u002For offshore wind industry. You must have extensive knowledge of transmission systems and experience with project engineering and\u002For project management in a matrix organization. You’ll also call on your degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent. <\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>We also hope you possess the following skills and experience: <\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li>Strong personal leadership in HSE and Quality, particularly in safe by design<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Experience in leading high-performing multidisciplinary teams<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Facilitator skills in opportunity framing and\u002For competitive scoping is a plus<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Expert knowledge of cost control philosophy and methodologies, estimating, change management, and document controls procedures required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> experience with budgets, scheduling and RFP processes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Outstanding interpersonal oral and written communication, presentation skills required.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated ability to manage multiple people from all types of fields of expertise.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrated ability to manage multiple primes and subcontractor relationships simultaneously<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Highly motivated, self-starter, ability to work well with others and be a good team player.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of risk evaluation and statistical modelling a plus.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Advanced knowledge of Office 365; MS Project application, Visio, MS Access, Word, Excel, SharePoint and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> In addition to the technical and project management skills described above, the successful candidate will need to be a strong team player with effective communication and relationship skills and strong analytical and problem-solving skills, when influencing and liaising with a multitude of different stakeholders.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell started operations in the United Kingdom more than 110 years ago. Since then, we have grown into a leading innovative Oil &amp; Energy company that rewards its employees by investing heavily in their careers and learning. Our people are our greatest asset, and our commitment to your career will see you thrive in a work environment that offers an industry-leading development programme. When your ideas travel, Shell will benefit, and innovation will thrive. Shell has a key role to play in helping meet the UK’s growing energy demand, whilst using innovative technologies to develop cleaner energy. We are the largest FTSE 100 company in the UK by market capitalisation and make a significant contribution to the UK economy. As well as processing 35% of the gas coming into the UK, we serve more than four million customers at our filling stations each week. Shell employs some 6,400 skilled staff as well as many contractors.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>The PS (Product Stewardship) Regulatory Advocacy Manager provides leadership and technical support to ensure product regulatory compliance and targeted advocacy on existing or emerging chemical management legislation in Europe. The role will include active representation including some leadership roles in regional and national trade associations. Along with understanding and implementing compliance requirements of existing legislation, the focus will be on monitoring and influencing on a technical and tactical level the emerging regulatory requirements driven by the EU Green Deal and the EU Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role must be able to translate existing and emerging regulatory requirements of REACH, the CLP Regulation and other related product legislation into impact on Shell’s businesses and communicate this impact to business stakeholders. The roles and responsibilities of this position are complementary to those of the REACH and Regulatory Compliance Manager (EMEA) and will require close collaboration. The PS Regulatory Advocacy Manager will support and advise senior leaders in their external positions in Program Councils, Board or Executive Committees.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role also includes interfacing and alignment with German Corporate Relations re. advocacy priorities and Corporate Governance on local compliance topics. The LPRL Germany will also have oversight on regulatory compliance by providing advice to the corporate HSSE function in Austria.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Acts as primary focal point for product regulatory requirements in Germany ensuring local legislation is correctly interpreted and implemented (“Local Product Regulatory Lead (LPRL) Germany”)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Coordinates and provides oversight of emerging regulatory activity in the region, liaises with designated business focal points and product stewardship staff and stakeholders, ensuring the Shell response to significant regulatory developments and issues is appropriate and progress is reported in a transparent way.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ensures that processes are in place to enable business compliance with applicable existing and new regulatory requirements.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Responsible for overall Product Regulatory compliance in Germany across the businesses, liaises with local networks and stakeholders, supports Shell’s “Powering Progress” strategy in Germany and provides confidence on product regulatory compliance to the Country Chair.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Represents Shell on appropriate external fora, such as Cefic, VCI, etc., to lead or contribute to joint industry approaches on regulatory topics, such as REACH, CLP etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Interacts with the Regulatory Compliance &amp; Advocacy team and other stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Contributes to the regular concise communication materials issued by the Global PS Regulatory Team<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develops a global perspective while working on local or regional issues to understand potential implications of emerging regulations in Europe on the global organization.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are open to considering candidates from the following locations: Wesseling\u002F Cologne, Hamburg, The Hague, Brussels<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Advanced degree in natural sciences (Chemistry, Biology, Health or Environmental Science, Industrial Hygiene).<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven working experience in HSE regulatory compliance work, specifically EU REACH and related legislation as well as a strong desire to further develop skills and expertise in this area.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A well-developed understanding of (petro)chemical product HSE issues.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> A broad understanding of international regulatory frameworks for product safety and a working knowledge of industrial hygiene, toxicology or environmental fate and effects as it applies to Shell products.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Knowledge of risk management techniques associated with product handling.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> External lens and connectivity: able to understand how Shell can influence the external world and how Shell is influenced by the external world.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills, ability to challenge self and others, build internal and external relationships based on trust and to integrate and network across multiple functions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Leadership and stakeholder engagement with strong oral and written communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Proven ability to lead or guide technical teams in a multi-cultural environment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong aptitude for Learner Mindset.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Willing to travel up to 30% of time.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Fluent in German and English language.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p><b>Unsere Unternehmenswerte<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell ist ein Unternehmen mit klaren Werten. Ehrlichkeit, Integrität und Respekt sind nicht nur ein Slogan: Sie sind ein Teil von allem, was wir tun. Darüber hinaus steht Shell als Unternehmen für Chancengleichheit, wir legen höchsten Wert auf die Vielfalt unserer Mitarbeiter*innen und auf unsere integrative Unternehmenskultur. Kommen Sie zu uns und Sie werden Teil eines Unternehmens, in dem die Energiewende im Mobilitätsbereich an vorderster Front vorantreiben.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Shell Mobility<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Mobility betreibt 46.000 Tankstellen in über 70 Ländern weltweit und bedient mehr als 30 Millionen Mobilitätskunden pro Tag. Damit ist Shell Mobility der größte kundenorientierte Geschäftsbereich innerhalb der Shell Gruppe und leistet einen entscheidenden Beitrag, um Shell als Low Carbon Leader zu etablieren. Dabei verfolgen wir das Ziel, die Nr. 1 unter den Mobilitäts- und Convenience-Einzelhändlern zu sein und über das weltweit führende EV-Ladenetzwerk zu verfügen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Was das Mobility Pricing Team auszeichnet<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Das Shell Mobility Pricing Team DACH gestaltet Endkundenpreise für Kraftstoffe und elektrische Ladeangebote in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz (DACH). Wir sind bestrebt, unseren Kund*innen wettbewerbsfähige Preise anzubieten und gleichzeitig eine zuverlässige Energieversorgung zu gewährleisten. Unsere Teammitglieder sind befähigt, eigenständig kommerzielle Entscheidungen zu treffen und Preisstrategien zu entwickeln, die einen optimalen integrierten Wertbeitrag schaffen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Stellenbeschreibung<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Die Preisgestaltung für Energieprodukte war noch nie so spannend und relevant wie heute. Dies ist eine fantastische Gelegenheit, einem motivierten, leidenschaftlichen und dynamischen Team beizutreten, das die Preise für Kraftstoffe und elektrische Ladeangebote in DACH laufend optimiert.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Die ausgeschriebene Position als „Pricing Advisor“ ist Teil des deutschen Teams und verantwortlich für die Entwicklung und Umsetzung der Preisstrategie an über 400 Shell Autobahntankstellen, Autohöfen sowie Markenpartner Tankstellen. Die Rolle ist in das weitere DACH-Team eingebettet, bietet jedoch gleichzeitig die einzigartige Gelegenheit, die Preisstrategie in diesen wichtigen Segmenten zu gestalten.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Die Rolle besteht aus zwei Komponenten:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Tagesgeschäft<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Optimierung des Kraftstoffvolumens und der Margenentwicklung für Stationen im eigenen Verantwortungsbereich<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Entwicklung, Überprüfung und Optimierung von Preisstrategien und -taktiken<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Sicherstellung der Konsistenz der Preisstrategien für B2C- und B2B-Kunden (wobei die Rolle nur den B2C Scope umfasst)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Aufbau und Aufrechterhaltung effektiver und vertrauensvoller Arbeitsbeziehungen mit dem Mobility Außendienst<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <li><p> Strategische Projekte<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Vorantreiben strategischer Initiativen auf Länder-\u002FCluster-Ebene, die das Potenzial haben, unseren Ergebnisbeitrag zu steigern. Beispiele hierfür sind der Aufbau von Partnerschaften mit externen Unternehmen, die Entwicklung von Preisstrategien für ein bestimmtes Segment, die Weiterentwicklung unserer Data-Science-Agenda oder das Vorantreiben von Angeboten für erneuerbare Energien<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Leitung von Projekten oder Workstreams, regelmäßig in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den Bereichen Marketing, Network sowie unserer Supply-Organisation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Wonach wir suchen<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Kenntnisse &amp; Fähigkeiten<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ausgeprägte kommerzielle Denkweise<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fundierte Kenntnisse in MS-Office-Anwendungen (z.B. Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kenntnisse des DACH-Tankstellengeschäfts und\u002Foder der Kraftstofflieferkette wünschenswert<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder verwandten Fächern<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Persönliche Charaktermerkmale<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Aufgeschlossene Persönlichkeit<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Widerstandsfähig in einem sehr volatilen Umfeld<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leidenschaftlich und motiviert, etwas zu bewegen<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ergebnisfokussiert und hohes Engagement zur Erreichung vereinbarter Ziele<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kommunikationsstark und ggfls Erfahrung in Zusammenarbeit über Organisationsgrenzen hinweg<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Entscheidungsfähigkeit\u002F-freude auch bei unklarer oder unvollständiger Datenlage<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Was wir bieten<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Mitarbeit in einem leidenschaftlichen, fürsorglichen und professionellen Team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Überdurchschnittliche Bezahlung je nach Qualifikation und bisherigen Erfahrungen, bestehend aus einem Grundgehalt, Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld sowie einem Bonus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten mit Office Standort in Hamburg sowie der Möglichkeit, mobil von Zuhause zu arbeiten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem weltweit führenden Energieunternehmen<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Hohes Maß an Befähigung, eigene Entscheidungen zu treffen mit großer to join our HR Operations team in Germany. The role will be located in <b>Cologne <\u002Fb>and give you the opportunity to partner with line managers on a broad range of HR matters and provide seamless end-to-end resolution of their HR queries. In addition you will provide coaching and feedback to line managers, equipping them to deal with HR related matters related to their teams as well as supporting the relationship with internal Employee Representative bodies.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Your main accountabilities will include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Partner with line managers on most complex HR matters, provide operational as well as tactical HR support<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide seamless end-to-end resolution of HR queries to line managers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Coordinate with Global and\u002For Local HR Consultants in case of (large scale) change initiatives, to ensure proper HR Advice support is provided to these initiatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide guidance and practical expertise to Line Managers on policy related issues to ensure the best performance of his\u002Fher team and the individuals within it<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Partner effectively with HR colleagues to analyse and intervene if needed<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible for delivering great employee experience through pro-actively addressing line manager needs<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide coaching and feedback to line managers, equipping the line managers to deal with HR related matters confidently, correctly and timely.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish strong working relationship with colleagues in country and the Center of Excellence to ensure the team can effectively partner when the situation requires<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Highlight and escalate issues with strategic, legal, employee relations or reputational risk to appropriate parties<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>The role is an exciting opportunity to join Nature Based Solutions (NBS) in Shell at a key growth stage, not just in Shell but also in the broader societal and corporate space. You will be working in a rapidly evolving business area, often in challenging regulatory and legal environments. You will be a part of a global and virtual team of capable and motivated individuals and as such, will benefit from the ability to work and form relationships with a diverse set of individuals.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Nature Based Solutions (NBS) comprise all activities related to the protection or restoration of natural ecosystems resulting in enhanced natural carbon sequestration, and the marketing, trading and sale of resulting carbon credits and other services and products. Shell is making a significant commitment to NBS, rooted in the scientific evidence that points to the substantial near-term role nature can play in fighting climate change and the additional benefits that investment in nature can generate.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Strategically, NBS can (1) complement the delivery of Shell’s Net Carbon Footprint ambition and thus has a role to play in Shell thriving through the energy transition, (2) be a credible option to allow us to address the CO2 footprint of the consumption of the energy products we sell together with our customers, and (3) be an attractive investment in carbon sequestration at a time when the world is becoming increasingly carbon-constrained. To achieve this, Shell is driving voluntary and compliance demand development for high-integrity nature-based carbon credits, developing a large and competitive supply portfolio to serve our customers, and contributing to a supportive societal and policy context for NBS.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What’s the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> As a Technical Manager for Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA), you will lead the technical and environmental assessment and maturation of opportunities in the EMEA region (likely also leading a team of technical managers) and to work with other leaders in the global NBS team and business developers in the NBS EMEA team to ensure the development of a balanced portfolio that is robust from economic, carbon management, environmental and societal perspectives.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be expected to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Work with and support the NBS General Manager EMEA on the implementation of the EMEA NBS business development strategy including:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Originate and mature business opportunities that generate carbon credits from nature, together with commercial and technical team members<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manage technical elements of business opportunities across the NBS EMEA portfolio ensuring that Shell’s investments in carbon credits from nature are of high quality underpinned by robust science and industry certification standards<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead assessment of the technical value (including environmental; community stakeholder participation; measurement, reporting and verification (MRV)) of individual NBS project\u002F program opportunities across the EMEA region with a specific focus on Africa<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Provide technical input and peer review for NBS projects in other regions as required<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Develop and maintain a network of advisors, consultants and implementation partners to strengthen the EMEA portfolio of opportunities and the delivery thereof<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Participate in and support engagements with industry fora, NGOs, governments and regulators regarding carbon accounting, fiscal and regulatory treatment of NBS opportunities, aimed at securing and sustaining long-term development opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Lead the assessment of opportunities related to developing MRV standards, including with certification bodies and industry groups<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re keen to speak with individuals with extensive business development experience that includes first-hand experience in planning, screening, developing and managing nature-based carbon sequestration projects in agriculture- or forestry-based methodologies, including measurement, reporting and verification. You’ll also call on your Master’s degree in environmental sciences, agriculture, forestry management, agronomy or similar field.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We also hope you possess the following skills and experience:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Highly skilled in carbon methodology implementation through first-hand project experience with certification bodies<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Rich understanding of key issues with carbon projects with extensive experience in assessing project baselines, nesting mechanisms, NBS carbon accounting, auditing and documentation standards and requirements in report preparation, and in extracting practical implications and opportunities<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Core knowledge of the areas relevant to NBS, including (agro-) forestry, carbon credit origination and trading, policy and regulations etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Team leadership and management experience, including virtual team leadership<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong relationship management skills and ability to gain trust and credibility quickly with many internal and external stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business development and effective stakeholder engagement and relationship building experience in Africa is a key requirement<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An entrepreneurial, flexible, hands-on, can-do approach, with a willingness to step in and support a range of activities as the NBS business grows<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Demonstrable passion for nature and a solution-oriented interest in the energy transition<\u002Fli>\n   <li> An attention to detail, ensuring development of and adherence to robust systems that withstand external scrutiny<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The position calls for a self-motivated, entrepreneurial and responsible individual with the proven ability to perform well under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> COMPANY DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future by investing in renewable energy and natural ecosystems and developing technology in new emerging energy supply and storage solutions that helps the world to use energy more cleanly and efficiently.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Der Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland ist einer der fünf Energie- und Chemieparks von Shell weltweit. Er besteht aus den beiden Standorten Süd (Wesseling) und Nord (Godorf) und hat ein großes Transformationsprogramm gestartet. Dabei werden die Standorte von einer Raffinerie- und Chemieanlage in einen Shell Energy and Chemicals Park der Zukunft umgewandelt. Dieser erfüllt und unterstützt die Energiewendeziele von Shell und hat eine bedeutende Rolle bei der Energiewende deutschlandweit und insbesondere des Rheinischen Reviers in NRW.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Es gab noch nie eine aufregendere Zeit, um bei Shell zu arbeiten. Jeder bei Shell trägt dazu bei, eine der größten Herausforderungen zu lösen, mit denen die Welt heute konfrontiert ist: die Vorteile der Energie für alle Menschen auf dem Planeten zu nutzen und gleichzeitig die Risiken des Klimawandels zu bewältigen.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Komm zu uns und Du wirst Dein Talent und Deine Vorstellungskraft in ein Unternehmen einbringen, das die Macht hat, die Zukunft zu gestalten - sei es durch Investitionen in erneuerbare Energien, die Erforschung neuer Wege zur Energiespeicherung, die Erzeugung von Wasserstoff oder die Entwicklung von Technologien, die der Welt helfen, Energie effizienter zu nutzen. Für diesen dynamischen Standort suchen wir erfahrene neue Kollegen, die Ihre Karriere und den Standort entscheidend voranbringen möchten.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Treibe die Transformationsreise mit uns an!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Elektroingenieur (Schwerpunkt Mess- und Regeltechnik \u002F Automatisierung) (m\u002Fw\u002Fd)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Deine Aufgaben: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p>Verantwortlicher Ingenieur für die Planung und Umsetzung der globalen Strategie im Shell Energy and Chemicals Park<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Zusammenarbeit mit einem internationalen Team<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Du bist zuständig für die Abwicklung von Projekten, von der Konzeptentwicklung bis zur technischen Umsetzung<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Leitung von spannenden und zukunftsorientierten Energieprojekte im Bereich der Mess- und Regeltechnik<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Koordination der externen Ressourcen und Kontraktoren<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Implementierung und Sicherstellung der Einhaltung der anzuwendenden Regelwerke, Normen und Verfahrensanweisungen<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Sicherstellung von Anlagenverfügbarkeit durch die Ausarbeitung von zukunftsorientierten MSR-Konzepten und Mitwirkung an den Sicherheitsbetrachtungen<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik, Automatisierungstechnik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Projekterfahrung bei der Planung von E- oder MSR Projekten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Kenntnisse der Produkte und Systeme der Automatisierungstechnik,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute Kenntnisse relevanter Normen, relevanter Standards, Gesetzen und Verordnungen (z.B. VDE, Ex-Schutz, Betriebssicherheitsverordnung)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute MS Office- und branchenüblichen CAE System-Kenntnisse<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ergebnisorientiert Arbeitsweise mit hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein für Qualität, Termine und Kosten<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Gute Kooperations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Interessiert?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Hast Du Lust in einer der 5 weltweiten Shell Energy and Chemicals Parks an den Energieherausforderungen von morgen zu arbeiten?<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Für unser Restaurant im Shell Autohof Ramstein suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Küchenmitarbeiter (m\u002Fw\u002Fd) als Koch\u002FKöchin, Beikoch\u002FBeiköchin und Küchenhilfe.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Bewirb dich jetzt!<\u002Fp>\n<p>Als Küchenmitarbeiter\u002F-in hast du die Küche voll im Griff. Du weißt genau, wie du Gerichte richtig zubereitest und liebst gutes Essen.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Wenn du die Arbeit im Team liebst, beim Gemüseschneiden in der Regel alle Finger behältst und Lust hast, dich beruflich weiterzuentwickeln, dann hast du beste Chancen, Teil unseres Teams zu werden.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Die Bezahlung ist individuell, je nach Qualifikation.<br>Deine Aufgaben variieren je nach Tätigkeit.<\u002Fp>\n<p>Einige davon sind:<br>Den Köchen zuarbeiten, Die Reinigung und Nachbereitung des Geschirrs, die Feststellung von Sauberkeit und Ordnung im gesamten Küchenbereich, vdas Portionieren und die Ausgabe des Menüs, das Anrichten des Frühstücks und die Einhaltung von Qualitätsvorgaben.<\u002Fp>\n<p><b>Das bringst Du mit<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n<ul>\n <li>Bestenfalls bringst Du
